intro: Borreria thymoidea, commonly known as Mexican thyme or creeping thyme, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in clusters. Its leaves are aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Borreria thymoidea thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
